title: EastEnders spoilers: Jags to save Chantelle from domestic abuser Gray?
text:
The Panesar clan arrived in Walford during EastEnders tonight, as they pulled out all the stops to track down someone in particular. However, while searching for said someone, it was Chantelle Atkins (Jessica Plummer) who caught Jags’ (Amar Adatia) eye, and it subsequently came to light that they knew each other — as he’d went on a date with her years earlier while they were in school. With a connection having been made between the two characters, could Jags end up proving instrumental getting Chantelle away from domestic abuser Gray (Toby Alexander-Smith)?

Yes, after their run-in with Ben (Max Bowden) several weeks back, Kheerat (Jaz Deol), Vinny (Shiv Jalota) and Jags Panesar arrived in Albert Square tonight, and they made clear their intention of tracking down their sister — who was revealed to be none other than Iqra’s (Priya Davdra) girlfriend, Ash (Gurlaine Kaur Garcha).

The trio of siblings split up, and they proceeded to search the market, the park and The Queen Vic. Vinny eventually tracked Ash down, and the pair had something of a heart-to-heart — although Ash reinforced how she’s never returning home.

Advertisement

Advertisement

However, another interesting discovery was made this evening, as — during his hunt for his sister — Jags set his sights upon Chantelle, and — although the two never exchanged any words — it was incredibly clear that he recognised her.

Jags recognised Chantelle (Picture: BBC)

A conversation with Kheerat later provided us with an explanation, as it came to light that Jags and Chantelle had went to school together — and that they once even went out on a date.

With both Kate Oates and Jon Sen having proven their ability at expertly linking separate narrative threads on more than one occasion, it’s safe to assume that this connection will be of huge importance going forward.

What’s more, it’s worth noting that this is really the first time we’ve learned something about Chantelle’s life prior to her marriage to Gray.

Since moving into the Square, Gray has isolated Chantelle in every way possible. With the exception of the time she spends with her family, her every move is monitored by her abusive husband — who’s made clear that he’d rather she remained at home where he can keep an eye on her.

Jags’ arrival will provide for yet another interesting dynamic to be explored should the two characters get reacquainted, and thus it could allow for viewers to see a different side of Chantelle.

What’s more, Gray will inevitably feel threatened by Jags’ presence on the Square. The solicitor has demonstrated how insecure he is in the past — something which he tends to take out on his wife — so learning that one of her ex’s lives close by will no doubt be a huge source of conflict for him.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Mind you, the Panesars have proven that you don’t want to get on the wrong side of them, so he’ll need to be careful that he doesn’t release his pent-up aggression in front of any one of the siblings.

Speaking of which, perhaps Jags will prove instrumental in exposing the abuse Chantelle has been suffering at the hands of Gray? It’s certainly a possibility — especially if they end up bonding or reminiscing about days gone by.

It’s also a possibility that Jags could be familiar with Gray as well. The two shared a glance during tonight’s episode, and the subtext certainly seems to suggest there was more to said glance than meets the eye — quite literally — but whether or not they’re affiliated remains to be seen.

Either way, linking the Panesars with Chantelle has opened up a multitude of narrative possibilities, and that’s something that EastEnders has been excelling at since Kate and Jon came on board.

Whether or not the abuse will be exposed by Jags remains to be seen, but Chantelle may have found herself a friend at the very least, and it’ll be great to see this new dynamic explored further.

EastEnders continues Thursday 31stOctober at 7:30pm on BBC One.

description: Jags arrived in Walford to find his sister, but he ended up making another huge discovery.
